messages: f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (06:54): wow, ARIA Role is worse than I thought. It's a band-aid solution written from an ivory tower, seemingly without seriously considering any authoring issues.
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (06:55): (I'm fairly sure I'll get flamed for saying that, but oh well)
77db19c1dd94414f199e58aa6ca1827f (06:59): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: can you name the accessibility experts you consulted before coming to that conclusion?

139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:00): actually, I do think some sort of tagging system for accessibility roles is useful, if only because web applications will want to get ahead of what browsers support natively
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:00): but I think ARIA Role is not a very good approach to doing that
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:00): I reached my conclusion from reading the spec
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:01): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: I was being needlessly sarcastic there
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:02): I know, but there are IRC log readers who might want the answer anyway
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:03): I agree with you, based also on reading the spec
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:03): mumbles something about having been saying that for years
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:03): although I think the intent is partly that JavaScript toolkit libraries will do all the heavy lifting, so the scope of authoring issues would be limited
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:04): BTW, wairole:grid is also addressed by <datagrid>
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:04): as far as i can tell, there isn't anything in wairole that isn't catered for by html5
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:05): (i used the wairole spec as a checklist a year ago or so and made sure)
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:05): tristate checkboxes?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:05): unfortunately, we can't rely on javascript toolkits (or any other tools) saving authors from the complexity
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:06): oh right, tristate checkboxes were on the list for wf2 but got bumped to wf3 because i couldn't work out how to submit them neatly
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:06): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, are they somewhere in the whatwg.org/issues/ list?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:06): how do normal checkboxes submit?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:07): when checked, they submit name=value.  when unchecked, they submit nothing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:07): lachy: they're probably in the big comment at the bottom of wf2's source
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:07): what lachy said

139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:07): the third (indeterminate/mixed) state of tristate checkboxes is mainly useful as an initial state when a group has mixed state and can be toggled on and off as a whole
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:07): there's an easy solution (have a second name for the mixed state) but i don't really like that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:08): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884: yeah but you still have to distinguish between left-in-initial-state and unchecked vs checked

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:08): I'm not sure mixed state checkboxes should be submitted, since they're usually representative of a group of other checkboxes, and so their state can be determined by examining the state of the others
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:08): mixed-state checkboxes mainly seem useful for cases where check/uncheck will be handled by script
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:09): possible
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:09): what (if anything) they submit can't just be left unspecified
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:09): indeed. AFAIK, there is no way for a user to explicity set an individual checkbox to a mixed state in any UI I've seen.
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:09): but it's possible that not submitting (just like an unchecked one) might be workable
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:10): maybe not though
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:10): well we'll see
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:10): wf3 is a far future thing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:10): and demand for tristate is low

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:11): the other alternative would be to introduce an attribute <input type=checkbox name=x value="foo" mixed="bar">, where x=foo is submitted in the normal case and x=bar for the mixed case
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:11): I'm probably going to suggest form features for HTML5 that aren't part of WF2 at some point
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:12): but I don't know if tristate would be high on the list

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:12): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884, are you or someone else from apple ever going to get around to providing details about placeholder=""? I recall that you once said someone would do so
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:12): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: I will remind the relevant person when she gets back from vacation
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:13): but I'm not sure there's a whole lot to say about it
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:13): <input type="search"> is probably something that will actually need revision to be spec-worthy, and explication of current behavior
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:13): I think most of placeholder is fairly obvious, but in case there's some not-so-obvious detail about it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:14): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: yeah i suggested that easy solution above :-)
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:14): I don't think there is anything non-obvious about placeholder
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (07:15): placeholder will be done before wf3 i'm sure

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:15): one thing about tristate checkbox that would need to be addressed is that typically, when checking one, the states of the related group of checkboxes is usually toggled too.
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:16): it might be possible to come up with a nice solution for that in the context of datagrid at least
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:18): I think there's definitely controls that would be more useful than some of the half-dozen different date controls in WF2
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:19): but I will save it until the current forms stuff is integrated into the main spec
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:19): (presumably after the Forms Task Force finishes deciding what it is supposed to do and then doing it)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (07:20): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884, is the forms task force ever going to get started?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:21): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: we're waiting on the sixth person to give a sign of life
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:21): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: there was some rumor that he might be on vacation
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (07:21): though I must admit so far it is the slowest-acting six-person group I have ever seen
